aston.group20.model

Class Aircraft

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.group20.model.Aircraft
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAircraft, java.lang.Comparable<IAircraft>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PoweredAircraft, UnpoweredAircraft

    public abstract class Aircraft
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAircraft
    The Aircraft class implements the IAircraft interface and contains the fields shared by all Aircraft and the majority of the method implementation required by the IAircraft interface, however it still allows for expansion and currently has two the two separate types of Aircraft below it (Powered & Unpowered) as well as the concrete subclasses (Commercial, Glider, Light).
    Version:
    1.0, March 2014
    Author:
    Group_20
    See Also:
    IAircraft

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Aircraft(int landingTime, int takeoffTime)
      Creating a new Aircraft which takes two parameters, the landing time and the takeoff time of the aircraft, both of which are measured in half minutes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(IAircraft a)
      This method compares this Aircraft with the parameter Aircraft by identifier; it can give information as to whether the parameter Aircraft is the same Aircraft as this Aircraft, was created before this Aircraft, or was created after this Aircraft.
      int getID()
      This method returns the Aircrafts unique identifier.
      int getLandingTime()
      This method returns the landing time of the Aircraft.
      int getMaintenanceTime()
      This method returns the current maintenance time of the Aircraft.
      int getTakeoffTime()
      This method returns the takeoff time of the Aircraft.
      int getWaitingTime()
      This method returns the waiting time of the Aircraft.
      void incrementMaintenanceTime()
      This method increments the maintenance time of the Aircraft.
      void incrementWaitingTime()
      This method increments the waiting time of the Aircraft.
      boolean isBrokeDown()
      This method returns a boolean which is true of the Aircraft has broken down, and false otherwise.
      boolean isCrashed()
      This method returns a boolean informing us as to whether or not the Aircraft has crashed; if true the Aircraft has crashed.
      boolean isFlying()
      This method returns whether or not the plane is in the air/flying.
      int nextID()
      This method returns the next identifier to be used by an Aircraft.
      void setBrokeDown(boolean brokeDown)
      This method sets the state of the boolean which tells us whether or not the Aircraft has broken down - if the parameter is true, than the Aircraft's state will be seen as broken down.
      void setIsFlying(boolean isFlying)
      This method sets the state of the boolean which tells us whether or not the plane is in the air/flying.
      void setWaitingTime(int waitingTime)
      This method sets the waiting time of the Aircraft.
      void step()
      This method updates the aircrafts's state; it will be fulfilled by the abstract classes PoweredAircraft and UnpoweredAircraft, which will define how the Aircrafts should act.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aircraft

        public Aircraft(int landingTime,
        int takeoffTime)
        Creating a new Aircraft which takes two parameters, the landing time and the takeoff time of the aircraft, both of which are measured in half minutes. The constructor also sets the default values upon creation of an Aircraft, such as the fact that it is not broken down, etc.
        Parameters:
        landingTime - the time the Aircraft takes to land.
        takeoffTime - the time the Aircraft takes to takeoff.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        This method updates the aircrafts's state; it will be fulfilled by the abstract classes PoweredAircraft and UnpoweredAircraft, which will define how the Aircrafts should act.
        Specified by:
        step in interface IAircraft

        public void setIsFlying(boolean isFlying)
        This method sets the state of the boolean which tells us whether or not the plane is in the air/flying. If the parameter is true, then the Aircraft will be seen to be in the air.
        Specified by:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(IAircraft a)
        This method compares this Aircraft with the parameter Aircraft by identifier; it can give information as to whether the parameter Aircraft is the same Aircraft as this Aircraft, was created before this Aircraft, or was created after this Aircraft.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<IAircraft>
        Parameters:
        a - the Aircraft in question.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this Aircraft is less than, equal to, or greater than the parameter Aircraft.
